bg.x2d.anim
Class EngineBase

java.lang.Object
  bg.x2d.anim.EngineBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Animator
public abstract class EngineBase
extends Object
implements Animator

The base animation engine provided by the 2DX library. Users are encouraged to override the drawFrame method in particular to implement project specific code. It is important, however, that this method calls upon runTasks so that the registered Drawable objects can be painted on-screen with each frame.

EngineBase submits its tasks to the AWTEventQueue to be executed in order to avoid concurrent graphics modification and adhere to Sun's recommended AWT/Swing programming behavior. To ensure the best performance possible, it is recommended that you avoid submitting other tasks to the AWTEventQueue while animating, so that the AWT thread can execute graphical tasks can be completed as quickly as possible.

Note: Do not use SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait() (or any other blocking method) in any Drawable objects passed to an EngineBase.

Since:
2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
Author:
Brian

EngineBase

public EngineBase()
Method Detail

drawFrame

public void drawFrame(Graphics2D g2)
Orders this engine to draw an updated frame onto the given Graphics2D object. Users are encouraged to override this method so that they can implement their own procedure. It is important, however, that runTasks(Graphics2D)
is called in order to execute all the engine's registered Drawable tasks.

Specified by:
drawFrame in interface Animator
Parameters:
g2 - the Graphics2D object on which to draw.
See Also:
runTasks(Graphics2D g2)

register

public void register(Drawable d)
Registers the given Drawable with this engine to be drawn with call to drawFrame(). This method is synchronized to prevent concurrent editing of the internal task List.

Parameters:
d - the Drawable to be registered

decommission

public boolean decommission(Drawable d)
Removes the passed Drawable from this engine's task list, so it will no longer be executed in future update calls. If the Drawable is not recognized, nothing happens and false is returned. This method is synchronized to prevent concurrent editing of the internal task List.

Parameters:
d - the Drawable object to be removed.
Returns:
true if the Drawable existed in the engine's task list, or false otherwise.

setBlocking

public void setBlocking(boolean block)
Configures this engine's blocking protocol. If set to true, the internal runTasks() method will block until all tasks have finished executing. Else, the method will return without waiting.
The default configuration is true.

Parameters:
block - value to which blocking should be configured.

willBlock

public boolean willBlock()
Gets the current blocking configuration of this engine.
The default setting is true.

Returns:
the current block configuration value.

getTasks

public ArrayList<Drawable> getTasks()
Fetches the engine's current task list. This method is synchronized to prevent concurrent editing of the internal task List.

Returns:
the ArrayList containing the registered Drawables.

runTasks

protected final void runTasks(Graphics2D g2)
Called to execute all currently registered Drawables. Blocks until all tasks have completed, if this engine is configured to do so.
This method cannot be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters:
g2 -
